get.description: Returns the status of a vet's Certificate of Eligibility application.

200.description:
Response is OK. Possible statuses:
            - ELIGIBLE: vet is automatically enrolled in a COE.
            - UNABLE_TO_DETERMINE_AUTOMATICALLY: vet must complete the COE form.
            - AVAILABLE: vet has filled out the COE form and it is available for download.
            - DENIED: means that the vet submitted a COE form but it was denied.
            - PENDING: vet submitted a COE form but it is still being reviewed.
            - PENDING_UPLOAD: vet submitted a COE form but must upload more supporting documents to be granted a COE.
            A reference_number is always returned.
            An application_create_date is returned unless the COE application is ELIGIBLE or PENDING.

get.description: Downloads Certificate of Eligiblity application as PDF

Retrieves a list of supporting documents that the             vet attached to their COE application. The `id` is used to fetch documents             via the `/vo/coe/document_download/{id}` endpoint below. The `mimeType`             is, unfortunately, the filename from which the front end pulls the file             extension. The `documentType` will either be "Veteran Correspondence"             (meaning, a document uploaded by the veteran during the COE form) or             the "kind" of notification letter (e.g. "COE Application First Returned").             By the time you read this, the `description` will probably be a description             of any "Veteran Correspondence." Notification letters should not have a             `description`.
Downloads supporting document with specified ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the supporting document.

200.description: MVI Orchestrated Search returned a Success response

post.description:
Make Orchestrated Search call to the Master Veteran Index (MVI)
            requesting that MVI make calls to upstream services to find or create the user's
            CorpDB (Corp) ID, and possibly the user's Beneficiary Identification and Records
            Locator Subsystem (BIRLS) ID. MVI will save the IDs it discovers to its own database.
            The Corp and BIRLS IDs are required prerequisites for serving the 21-0966 Intent to File
            form and 21-526EZ disability claim form to the client.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
ID of the form. Allowed values: '21-0966' (Intent to File),
              '21-526EZ' (Disability Compensation)

Gets the most recent transactions for a user. Response will include an array of transactions that are still in progress, or that were just updated to COMPLETED during the course of this request. The array will be empty if no transactions are pending or updated. Only the most recent transaction for each profile field will be included so there may be up to 4 (Address, Email, Telephone, Permission).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number for the page of results that is being requested

query.description: The term used to generate these search results

spelling_correction.description: Spelling correction for your search term.

text_best_bets.description: Text best bets, which appear only when the query matches the text of the best bet’s title, description, or keywords.

graphic_best_bets.description: Graphic best bets, which appear only when the query matches the text of the best bet’s title, description, or keywords.

links.description: An array of links in the graphic best bet. Each link contains a title and a URL

related_topics.description: An array of topics related to the health topic. Each topic contains a title and a URL

related_sites.description: An array of sites related to the the health topic. Each site contains a title and a URL

minimum.description: Minimum salary of the job opening

maximum.description: Maximum salary of the job opening

locations.description: An array of locations of the job opening

screen_name.description: Screen name of the tweet author

agency_names.description: An array of agency names of the federal register document

related_search_terms.description: An array of related search terms, which are based on recent, common searches on the your site.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: the url of the link that was clicked

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: the search query used to generate results

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position/rank of the result on your search results page. Was it the first result or the second?

parameters.name: user_agent

parameters.name: module_code
parameters.description: I14Y for web urls, BOOS for best bets, defaults to I14Y

Initializes Sign in Service authorization & authentication.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Credential provider selected to authenticate with. Values: `logingov`, `idme`, `mhv`, `dslogon`

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Determines cookie (web) vs. API (mobile) authentication. Values: `web`, `mobile`.

parameters.name: acr
parameters.description: Level of authentication requested, dependant on CSP. Values: `loa1`, `loa3`, `ial1`, `ial2`, `min`.

parameters.name: code_challenge
parameters.description: Value created from a `code_verifier` hex that is hash and encoded.

parameters.name: code_challenge_method
parameters.description: Method used to create code_challenge (*must* equal `S256`).

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Client-provided code that is returned to the client upon successful authentication. Minimum length is 22 characters.

200.description: User is redirected to credential service provider via a frontend form submission.

get.description: Sign in Service authentication callback.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Authentication code created by the credential provider & used to obtain tokens from them.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Encoded payload that includes information passed from vets-api to credential provider in `/authorize` call.

302.description: User object is created in vets-api, then redirected back to client with an authentication code that can be used to obtain tokens. If a `state` param was included in the original `/authorize` request it will be returned here.

post.description: Sign in Service session creation & tokens request.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: Authentication grant type value, must equal `authorization_code`.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Authentication code passed to the client through the `code` param in authentication `/callback` redirect.

parameters.name: code_verifier
parameters.description: Original hex that was hashed and SHA256-encoded to create the `code_challenge` used in the `/authenticate` request.

200.description: Authentication code and code_verifier validated, session and tokens created & tokens returned to client.

post.description: Sign in Service session & tokens refresh.

parameters.name: anti_csrf_token
parameters.description: Anti CSRF token, used to match `/refresh` calls with the `token` call that generated the refresh token used - currently disabled, this can be ignored.

200.description: Refresh token validated, session updated, new tokens created and returned to client.

get.description: Sign in Service user introspection.

200.description: Access token validated, user attributes are serialized and rendered to client.

post.description: Sign in Service session destruction.

parameters.name: refresh_token
parameters.description: Refresh token string, must be URI-encoded.

parameters.name: anti_csrf_token
parameters.description: Anti CSRF token, used to match `refresh` calls with the `token` call that generated the refresh token used - currently disabled, this can be ignored.

200.description: Refresh token validated & session destroyed, invalidating connected tokens.

get.description: Sign in Service destruction of all of a user's sessions.

200.description: Access token validated & included `user_uuid` used to look up & destroy all of a user's sessions.

get.description: User-initiated logout of their Sign in Service session.

302.description: Access token validated & session destroyed, invalidating connected tokens. User is redirected to credential provider to end their session, then redirect back to VA.gov frontend.

meta.description: The response from the EVSS service to vets-api

Meta.description: The response from the EVSS service to vets-api

num.description: the same cemetary id yet again, why not?

account_uuid.description: A UUID correlating all user identifiers. Intended to become the user's UUID.

mhv_account_state.description: DEACTIVATED: user has at least one MHV id that is not active; NONE: user has no active MHV ids; MULTIPLE: user has multiple active MHV ids; OK: user has one MHV id and its active

hlrCreateDataAttributes.description: If informal conference requested (`informalConference: true`), availability must be specified (`informalConferenceTimes`). Explanation of abbreviated benefit types: `pension`: Pension / Survivor's Benefits, `voc_rehab`: Vocational Rehabilitation and Employment, `vha`: Veterans Health Administration, `nca`: National Cemetery Administration

hlrCreatePhone.description: The phone number of the veteran. Cannot exceed 20 characters when all fields are concatenated.

timezone.description: Veteran's timezone (either [IANA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) or [Rails](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activesupport/lib/active_support/values/time_zone.rb) style). Used for adding the current date to the signature according to the veteran's local time. If not specified, the current UTC date will be used for the signature (which may be ahead or behind the local date).

zipCode5.description: 5-digit zipcode. Use "00000" if Veteran is outside the United States

items.description: A contestable issue (to contest this, you include it as a RequestIssue when creating a HigherLevelReview, SupplementalClaim, or Appeal)

ratingDecisionReferenceId.description: The BGS ID for the contested rating decision. This may be populated while ratingIssueReferenceId is nil

titleOfActiveReview.description: Title of DecisionReview that this issue is still active on

sourceReviewType.description: The type of DecisionReview (HigherLevelReview, SupplementalClaim, Appeal) the issue was last decided on (if any)

timely.description: An issue is timely if the receipt date is within 372 dates of the decision date.

latestIssuesInChain.description: Shows the chain of decision and rating issues that preceded this issue. Only the most recent issue can be contested (the object itself that contains the latestIssuesInChain attribute).

isRating.description: Whether or not this is a RatingIssue

hlrContestableIssues.description: Fields may either be null or the type specified

nodCreateTimezone.description: Veteran's timezone (either [IANA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) or [Rails](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activesupport/lib/active_support/values/time_zone.rb) style). Used for adding the current date to the signature according to the veteran's local time. If not specified, the current UTC date will be used for the signature (which may be ahead or behind the local date).

items.description: A contestable issue (to contest this, you include it as a RequestIssue when creating a HigherLevelReview, SupplementalClaim, or Appeal)

ratingDecisionReferenceId.description: The BGS ID for the contested rating decision. This may be populated while ratingIssueReferenceId is nil

titleOfActiveReview.description: Title of DecisionReview that this issue is still active on

sourceReviewType.description: The type of DecisionReview (HigherLevelReview, SupplementalClaim, Appeal) the issue was last decided on (if any)

timely.description: An issue is timely if the receipt date is within 372 dates of the decision date.

latestIssuesInChain.description: Shows the chain of decision and rating issues that preceded this issue. Only the most recent issue can be contested (the object itself that contains the latestIssuesInChain attribute).

isRating.description: Whether or not this is a RatingIssue

text.example: The tx for id/criteria XZY could not be found.
The tx for id/criteria XZY could not be found.

detail.example: Received a bad request response from the upstream server
detail.description: possibly some additional info, or just the class name again

code.description:
Sometiems just the http code again, sometimes something like "EVSS400", where" \
                        " the code can be found in config/locales/exceptions.en.yml

detail.example: User does not have access to the requested resource due to missing values: corp_id, edipi

enum: VA Form 21-0781a - Statement in Support of Claim for PTSD Secondary to Personal Assault

title.description: Title of the form as given by VA

last_revision_on.description: The date the form was last updated

pages.description: Number of pages contained in the form

sha256.description: A sha256 hash of the form contents

program_type.description: The classification of the program, ex: IHL, NCD, OJT

city.description: The city name where the Yellow Ribbon Program is located.

country.description: The country where the Yellow Ribbon Program is located.

degree_level.description: The degree levels available to the Yellow Ribbon Program.

division_professional_school.description: The majors/minors of the Yellow Ribbon Program.

facility_code.description: The faciliy code of the Yellow Ribbon Program.

institution_id.description: The instutition ID the Yellow Ribbon Program belongs to.

insturl.description: The URL for the Yellow Ribbon Program's instutition.

number_of_students.description: The number of students that can receive the benefit.

state.description: The provincial state where the Yellow Ribbon Program is located.

street_address.description: The street address where the Yellow Ribbon Program is located.

access_token.description: Access token, used to obtain user attributes - 5 minute expiration

refresh_token.description: Refresh token, used to refresh a session and obtain new tokens - 30 minute expiration

anti_csrf_token.description: Anti CSRF token, used to match `refresh` calls with the `token` call that generated the refresh token used - currently disabled, this can be ignored

zip.description: The user's zip code from MPI

multifactor.description: ID.me boolean value if the signed-in 'wallet' has multifactor enabled

authn_context.description:
The login method of a user.
                                     If a user logs in using a DS Logon Username and password and then goes through
                                     identity verification with id.me their login type would be dslogon_loa3.
                                     or if they logged in with dslogon and added multifactor authentication through
                                     id.me their authn_context would be dslogon_multifactor

service_name.description:
The name of the service that the user used for the beginning of the
                                       authentication process (username + password)

account_type.description: myhealthevet account_types: Basic, Premium. dslogon account account_types: 1-3

ssoe.description: true if the user was authenticated using SSOe

transactionid.description: a unique id representing the authentication transaction with SSOe

current.description: NIST level of assurance, either 1 or 3

highest.description:
level of assurance - During the login flow reference 'highest', otherwise, use
                                       'current'

area_code.description:
The three-digit code that begins a North American (the U.S., Canada and Mexico) phone
                   number.

country_code.description:
First two to four digits of a non- North American phone number that routes the call to
                   country of that phone number.

extension.description:
One-or-more digit number that must be dialed after reaching a main number, typically at
                   an establishment, in order to reach a specific party.

is_textable.description: Indicates phone number is capable of receiving text messages.

is_text_permitted.description: Indicates person has granted permission to receive text messages to phone number.

is_tty.description:
Indicates phone number has TTY capability (TeleTypewriter). This allows deaf or hard of
                   hearing individuals to utilize typing versus voice over a phone connection.

is_voicemailable.description: Indicates person has granted consent to record a voice mail message on a phone number.

phone_number.description:
Number that follows an area code for a North American phone number, or a country code
                   for a non-North American phone number.

phone_type.description: Describes specific type of phone number.

source_date.description: The date the source system received the last update to this bio.

vet360_id.description:
Unique Identifier of individual within VET360. Created by VET360 after it is validated
                   and accepted. May be considered PII.
